verses.text: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ نٓ وَٱلْقَلَمِ وَمَا يَسْطُرُونَ
verses.translation_en: Nun. By the pen and what they inscribe,
verses.translation_zh: 努奈。以笔和他们所写的盟誓，

verses.translation_en: You are not, [O Muhammad], by the favor of your Lord, a madman.
verses.translation_zh: 你为主的恩典，你绝不是一个疯人，

verses.translation_en: And indeed, for you is a reward uninterrupted.
verses.translation_zh: 你必得享受不断的报酬。

verses.translation_en: And indeed, you are of a great moral character.
verses.translation_zh: 你确是具备一种伟大的性格的。

verses.translation_en: So you will see and they will see
verses.translation_zh: 你将看见，他们也将看见，

verses.translation_en: Which of you is the afflicted [by a devil].
verses.translation_zh: 你们究竟谁是害疯病的。

verses.text: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلْمُهْتَدِينَ
verses.translation_en: Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has gone astray from His way, and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.
verses.translation_zh: 你的主的确知道谁是叛离他的正道的，他的确知道谁是遵循他的正道的。

verses.translation_en: Then do not obey the deniers.
verses.translation_zh: 你不要顺从否认真理的人们，

verses.translation_en: They wish that you would soften [in your position], so they would soften [toward you].
verses.translation_zh: 他们希望你柔顺，他们也柔顺。

verses.translation_en: And do not obey every worthless habitual swearer
verses.translation_zh: 你不要顺从每个妄誓的、卑贱的、

verses.translation_en: [And] scorner, going about with malicious gossip -
verses.translation_zh: 说谎的、进馋的、

verses.translation_en: A preventer of good, transgressing and sinful,
verses.translation_zh: 吝啬的、过份的、犯罪的、

verses.translation_en: Cruel, moreover, and an illegitimate pretender.
verses.translation_zh: 粗鄙而且是私生子的人。

verses.translation_en: Because he is a possessor of wealth and children,
verses.translation_zh: 那是因为他是有财产和子嗣的。

verses.text: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.translation_en: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the former peoples."
verses.translation_zh: 有人对他宣读我的迹象时，他就说：这是古人的故事。

verses.translation_en: We will brand him upon the snout.
verses.translation_zh: 我将在他的鼻子上打上烙印。

verses.text: إِنَّا بَلَوْنَٰهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَآ أَصْحَٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا۟ لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ
verses.translation_en: Indeed, We have tried them as We tried the companions of the garden, when they swore to cut its fruit in the [early] morning
verses.translation_zh: 我确已考验他们，犹如考验园圃的主人们一样。当时，他们曾盟誓，他们必定在早晨收获园圃中的果实，

verses.translation_en: Without making exception.
verses.translation_zh: 并不留一部分给贫民。

verses.text: فَطَافَ عَلَيْهَا طَآئِفٌ مِّن رَّبِّكَ وَهُمْ نَآئِمُونَ
verses.translation_en: So there came upon the garden an affliction from your Lord while they were asleep.
verses.translation_zh: 当他们正在睡觉的时候，从你的主发出的灾难降临那个园圃，

verses.translation_en: And it became as though reaped.
verses.translation_zh: 一旦之间变成焦土一样。

verses.translation_en: And they called one another at morning,
verses.translation_zh: 他们曾在早晨彼此相呼：

verses.text: أَنِ ٱغْدُوا۟ عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَٰرِمِينَ
verses.translation_en: [Saying], "Go early to your crop if you would cut the fruit."
verses.translation_zh: 你们当在早晨到园里去，如果你们要想收获。

verses.translation_en: So they set out, while lowering their voices,
verses.translation_zh: 他们走了，途中悄悄地商议说：

verses.text: أَن لَّا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا ٱلْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُم مِّسْكِينٌ
verses.translation_en: [Saying], "There will surely not enter it today upon you [any] poor person."
verses.translation_zh: 今天绝不要让一个贫民走进园圃。

verses.translation_en: And they went early in determination, [assuming themselves] able.
verses.translation_zh: 他们早晨起来以为自己是能遏制的。

verses.translation_en: But when they saw it, they said, "Indeed, we are lost;
verses.translation_zh: 当他们看见园圃的时候，他们说：我们碓是迷误的，

verses.translation_en: Rather, we have been deprived."
verses.translation_zh: 不然，我们是被剥夺的！

verses.text: قَالَ أَوْسَطُهُمْ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكُمْ لَوْلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ
verses.translation_en: The most moderate of them said, "Did I not say to you, 'Why do you not exalt [Allah]?' "
verses.translation_zh: 他们中最优秀的人说：难道我没有对你们说吗？你们怎么不赞颂真主呢？

verses.text: قَالُوا۟ سُبْحَٰنَ رَبِّنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَٰلِمِينَ
verses.translation_en: They said, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."
verses.translation_zh: 他们说：赞颂我们的主超绝万物！我们确是不义的。

verses.translation_en: Then they approached one another, blaming each other.
verses.translation_zh: 於是他们大家走向前来，互相责备起来。

verses.translation_en: They said, "O woe to us; indeed we were transgressors.
verses.translation_zh: 他们说：伤哉我们！我们原来确是放荡者。

verses.text: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَآ أَن يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْرًا مِّنْهَآ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَٰغِبُونَ
verses.translation_en: Perhaps our Lord will substitute for us [one] better than it. Indeed, we are toward our Lord desirous."
verses.translation_zh: 或许我们的主，以一个比这还好的园圃，补偿我们，我们确是恳求我们的主的。

verses.text: كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْعَذَابُ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْءَاخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.translation_en: Such is the punishment [of this world]. And the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.
verses.translation_zh: 刑罚就是那样的。后世的刑罚确是更重大的，假如他们知道。

verses.text: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
verses.translation_en: Indeed, for the righteous with their Lord are the Gardens of Pleasure.
verses.translation_zh: 敬畏的人们，在他们的主那里，必将享受恩泽的乐园。

verses.translation_en: Then will We treat the Muslims like the criminals?
verses.translation_zh: 难道我使归顺的人像犯罪的人一样吗？

verses.translation_en: What is [the matter] with you? How do you judge?
verses.translation_zh: 你们有甚么理由？你们怎么这样的判断呢！

verses.translation_en: Or do you have a scripture in which you learn
verses.translation_zh: 难道有一本可供你们诵习的天经，

verses.translation_en: That indeed for you is whatever you choose?
verses.translation_zh: 在那本天经里你们确有自己所选择的。

verses.text: أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَٰنٌ عَلَيْنَا بَٰلِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَٰمَةِ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَمَا تَحْكُمُونَ
verses.translation_en: Or do you have oaths [binding] upon Us, extending until the Day of Resurrection, that indeed for you is whatever you judge?
verses.translation_zh: 难道我曾与你们缔结过复活日才满期的、坚定的盟约，因而你们确有你们所判断的？

verses.translation_en: Ask them which of them, for that [claim], is responsible.
verses.translation_zh: 你问他们，他们中有谁能保证那件事呢？

verses.text: أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَآءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا۟ بِشُرَكَآئِهِمْ إِن كَانُوا۟ صَٰدِقِينَ
verses.translation_en: Or do they have partners? Then let them bring their partners, if they should be truthful.
verses.translation_zh: 难道他们有许多配主吗？教他们把那些配主召唤来，如果 他们是诚实的人。

verses.text: يَوْمَ يُكْشَفُ عَن سَاقٍ وَيُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
verses.translation_en: The Day the shin will be uncovered and they are invited to prostration but the disbelievers will not be able,
verses.translation_zh: 在那日，大难将临头，他们将被召去叩头，而他们不能叩头。

verses.text: خَٰشِعَةً أَبْصَٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ وَقَدْ كَانُوا۟ يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَٰلِمُونَ
verses.translation_en: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. And they used to be invited to prostration while they were sound.
verses.translation_zh: 同时，他们身遭凌辱，不敢仰视。而过去他们健全的时候，曾被召去叩头。

verses.text: فَذَرْنِى وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهَٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُم مِّنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.translation_en: So leave Me, [O Muhammad], with [the matter of] whoever denies the Qur'an. We will progressively lead them [to punishment] from where they do not know.
verses.translation_zh: 你让我惩治否认这训辞的人吧！我将使他们不知不觉地渐趋於毁灭。

verses.translation_en: And I will give them time. Indeed, My plan is firm.
verses.translation_zh: 我优容他们，我的计策确是周密的。

verses.text: أَمْ تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ
verses.translation_en: Or do you ask of them a payment, so they are by debt burdened down?
verses.translation_zh: 你向他们索取报酬，教他们担负太重呢？

verses.translation_en: Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen, so they write [it] down?
verses.translation_zh: 还是他们能知幽玄，故加以记录呢？

verses.text: فَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ ٱلْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌ
verses.translation_en: Then be patient for the decision of your Lord, [O Muhammad], and be not like the companion of the fish when he called out while he was distressed.
verses.translation_zh: 故你应当忍受你的主的判决，不要像那个葬身鱼腹的人一样。当时，他拗著怒呼吁他的主；

verses.text: لَّوْلَآ أَن تَدَٰرَكَهُۥ نِعْمَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ لَنُبِذَ بِٱلْعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ مَذْمُومٌ
verses.translation_en: If not that a favor from his Lord overtook him, he would have been thrown onto the naked shore while he was censured.
verses.translation_zh: 假若从他的主发出的恩典没有达到他，那末，他必受责备地被抛到荒凉的地方。

verses.translation_en: And his Lord chose him and made him of the righteous.
verses.translation_zh: 嗣后，他的主拣选了他，并使他入於善人之列。

verses.text: وَإِن يَكَادُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ بِأَبْصَٰرِهِمْ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا۟ ٱلذِّكْرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُۥ لَمَجْنُونٌ
verses.translation_en: And indeed, those who disbelieve would almost make you slip with their eyes when they hear the message, and they say, "Indeed, he is mad."
verses.translation_zh: 不信道的人们几乎以他们的怒目使你跌倒。当他们听到宣读教诲的时候，他们说：他确是一个疯子。

verses.translation_en: But it is not except a reminder to the worlds.
verses.translation_zh: 这《古兰经》不是别的，它是对全世界的教诲。
